revised_title: Mechanisms of Vertebrate Sex Determination: Correcting Sex Reversal in C57BL/6J-Y Mice with a Sry Transgene
tldr: Researchers discovered that the Sry gene from the Mus domesticus poschiavinus Y chromosome is responsible for ovarian tissue development in C57BL/6J XYPOS mice. By introducing a functional Sry gene as a transgene, they were able to correct the sex reversal condition in these mice, proving that the Sry gene is the primary cause of the abnormal development.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Genomics
